First federal health officials say they may allow states to opt out of some of the Affordable CARE Act bedrock rules
The new guidance encourage states to allow health insurance companies to offer plans with fewer benefits at lower prices and for the first time people who buy those policies may be able to use government subsidies to pay for them
Separately the Trump Administration is proposing new regulations that would allow companies to give their employees money to buy insurance on their own the administration says the plan would give workers more choices and add competition
